title: Add a third homepage color style variation (Style C) for the unauthenticated landing page

requirements.text: Add an additional homepage style variant (Style C) that provides a distinct, cohesive color palette for the unauthenticated homepage (PublicOverviewPage + MarketingBanner) in both light and dark modes, without changing existing Style A or Style B behavior.
acceptanceCriteria: A new variant option exists in the homepage style variant system (currently 'A' | 'B') to support a third variant (e.g., 'C').
The new variant persists via the existing localStorage key (homepage-style-variant) and loads correctly on refresh.
PublicOverviewPage applies a new CSS scope class for Style C (similar to home-style-b) when the variant is set to C.
MarketingBanner accepts and handles the new variant value and applies appropriate styling so text, badges, and controls remain readable in both light and dark mode.

requirements.text: Define Style C theme overrides using CSS variables in `frontend/src/index.css` (light + dark) under a new scope class (e.g., `.home-style-c` and `.dark .home-style-c`) to achieve a clearly different but consistent palette across background/card/accent/border/ring/muted/secondary.
acceptanceCriteria: `frontend/src/index.css` includes Style C variable overrides for light mode.
`frontend/src/index.css` includes Style C variable overrides for dark mode.
Style C updates only CSS variables (no global breakage): other pages and variants render as before.
In Style C, key surfaces (background, cards, banner gradient) have sufficient contrast for headings/body text and UI controls in both light and dark mode.

requirements.text: Update the style toggle control on `frontend/src/pages/PublicOverviewPage.tsx` so users can cycle through A → B → C (and back), and ensure the UI reflects the currently selected variant.
acceptanceCriteria: The toggle control on the public overview page can select all three variants without requiring manual localStorage edits.
When Style C is selected, the page container uses the Style C scope class and the MarketingBanner receives the variant prop value 'C'.
No TypeScript errors occur due to the expanded variant union type across components using the variant prop/state.

constraints: Do not edit any files under `frontend/src/components/ui` (read-only UI components).
Do not modify immutable frontend hook files listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT; compose around them where necessary.
Keep all changes within the existing React + TypeScript + Tailwind + React Query stack (no new frameworks or backend services).
nonGoals: Do not redesign non-homepage pages or change the app’s content/copy as part of this request.
Do not change backend canister logic; this is a frontend-only style variation.
